bytebase.v1.AuditLog.jsonschema.json.description: Audit log entry recording system activity or API call.

^(create_time)$.description: The timestamp when the audit log was created.

^(service_data)$.description: Service-specific metadata about the request, response, and activities.

createTime.description: The timestamp when the audit log was created.

method.description:
The method or action being audited.
 For example: /bytebase.v1.SQLService/Query or bb.project.repository.push

request.description: The request payload in JSON format.

resource.description: The resource associated with this audit log.

response.description:
The response payload in JSON format.
 Some fields may be omitted if they are too large or contain sensitive information.

serviceData.description: Service-specific metadata about the request, response, and activities.

severity.description: The severity level of this audit log entry.
severity.title: Severity

user.description:
The user who performed the action.
 Format: users/{email}

bytebase.v1.AuditLog.jsonschema.json.title: Audit Log

^(caller_ip)$.description: The IP address of the request originator.

^(caller_supplied_user_agent)$.description:
The user agent string provided by the caller.
 This is supplied by the client and is not authenticated.

callerIp.description: The IP address of the request originator.

callerSuppliedUserAgent.description:
The user agent string provided by the caller.
 This is supplied by the client and is not authenticated.

bytebase.v1.SearchAuditLogsResponse.json.description: Response message for searching audit logs.

^(next_page_token)$.description:
A token to retrieve next page of log entities.
 Pass this value in the page_token field in the subsequent call
 to retrieve the next page of log entities.

nextPageToken.description:
A token to retrieve next page of log entities.
 Pass this value in the page_token field in the subsequent call
 to retrieve the next page of log entities.

bytebase.v1.SearchAuditLogsResponse.json.title: Search Audit Logs Response

google.rpc.Status.jsonschema.json.description:
You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
 [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description:
The status code, which should be an enum value of
 [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
 message types for APIs to use.

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
 user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
 [google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized
 by the client.

google.rpc.Status.jsonschema.json.title:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
 different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
 used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
 three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.
